overview.short: Fusobacterium necrophorum is a Gram-negative, obligately anaerobic rod strongly associated with invasive head and neck infections.
overview.clinical_context: Classically linked to Lemierreâ€™s syndrome (post-pharyngitis septic thrombophlebitis) and can cause abscesses and bacteremia.

species_markers.notes: More consistently nitrate-positive than some other Fusobacterium species.
Supports necrophorum/nucleatum grouping versus indole-negative fusobacteria.
Supports an invasive fusobacterial profile when combined with clinical context.

common_confusions.reason: Both are indole-positive anaerobic rods and may overlap on basic biochemical panels.
Shared anaerobic growth with limited carbohydrate differentiation in routine workflows.

when_to_question_identification: Indole negativity suggests another Fusobacterium species.
Aerobic growth is inconsistent with Fusobacterium necrophorum.
Strong saccharolytic fermentation pattern argues against necrophorum.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Confirms indole status and supports species-level assignment.
Helps separate necrophorum from other fusobacteria when positive.
Best practical confirmation for anaerobic species when available.
